page.title: 14JOHN WRIGHT
page.content: JOHN WRIGHT EAST KILBRIDE John Wright was born in 1911 and was educated at East Kilbride village school. He was the person who convened the first public meeting to discuss the formation of a new town. He had been elected to the Fifth District Council in 1958 and became a town councillor when the new town was formed in 1963. He was one of only two people born in East Kilbride and on the new town council. He was elected Provost of East Kilbride in May 1966 and opened the new Civic Centre building. John Wright worked in Waterlows_a well_known local printing firm. A few days before he died on June 17 1970, John Wright was awarded the O.B.E.(Order of the British Empire) for services to his community.
